name: Cary Grant Movies Quiz | People Themed | 10 Questions

questions.text: Grant had a starring role in "The Bishop's Wife". Who played the title role?
questions.explanation:
Loretta Young.

	With David Niven. Pleasant.

questions.text: In "Arsenic and Old Lace", Grant is horrified to find that people are being poisoned. How is the poison being administered?
questions.explanation:
Wine.

	Elderberry wine, to be precise. Grant's best comedy?

questions.text: In "Night and Day", Grant played what composer?
questions.explanation:
Cole Porter.

	Danny Thomas played composer Gus Kahn in a different movie.

questions.text: Which of these Doris Day movies had Grant in the cast?
questions.explanation:
That Touch of Mink.

	"Boat" starred Rod Taylor; "Pillow" and "Flowers" starred Rock Hudson.

questions.text: Who co-starred with Grant in "Mr. Lucky"?
questions.explanation:
Laraine Day.

	Russell was in "His Girl Friday". Hepburn was in "Charade". Fontaine was in "Suspicion". Overlooked Grant movie.

questions.text: "She Done Him Wrong" teamed Grant with what screen legend?
questions.explanation:
Mae West.

	Early in his career. Hepburn was in "Philadelphia Story" and in "Bringing Up Baby".

questions.text: Which of these war movies starred Grant?
questions.explanation:
Destination Tokyo.

	All were submarine stories. "Silent" starred Clark Gable and Burt Lancaster, "Persicope" starred James Garner and Edmond O'Brien,  and "Beach" starred Gregory Peck.

questions.text: "Affair to Remember" teamed Grant with Deborah Kerr. Who played the odd-man-out who was romantically interested in Kerr?
In "North by Northwest", Grant is suspected of murder. Who did he supposedly kill?
questions.explanation:
Diplomat.

	His victim was killed at the U.N. Fine Hitchcock - and - Grant effort.

questions.text: What is Grant's "disguise" in "To Catch A Thief"?
questions.explanation:
Lumberman.

	Ostensibly from Oregon. Another top effort with Hitchcock.
